title: Who Is Dina Boluarte, Peru’s New and First Woman President?
description: Ms. Boluarte, the country’s first woman president, ascended to power suddenly, after her predecessor was arrested. She takes power as corruption and discontent test democracies across Latin America.

title: In the Deal to Free Griner, Putin Used a Familiar Lever: Pain
description: By seizing the basketball star, the Russian president made things so painful for the U.S. that it capitulated and turned over a convicted arms dealer. Can the same tactic work in the war in Ukraine?

title: Russian State Media Releases Video of Brittney Griner and Viktor Bout Swap
description: The images, verified by The New York Times, show Ms. Griner being traded for the arms dealer Viktor Bout on the tarmac at Al Bateen Executive Airport in Abu Dhabi.

title: The Villain So Far in ‘Harry & Meghan’? Not the Royal Family.
description: Harry and Meghan focused their ire in their Netflix documentary on the tabloids they say have hounded them out of remorseless greed and scarcely concealed racism.

title: More Americans Are Being ‘Wrongfully Detained’ and Held Abroad
description: A State Department official said over the summer that there were between 40 and 50 Americans being wrongfully detained by foreign governments.

title: American Given 8-Month Suspended Sentence in Traffic Death of British Teen
description: Anne Sacoolas, a U.S. government employee, had fled England after hitting motorcyclist Harry Dunn, 19, with her car. His parents, who fought for three years to bring her to justice, said, “Harry, we done it.”

title: Johnny Johnson, the Last World War II ‘Dambuster,’ Dies at 101
description: With the Royal Air Force, he took part in a morale-boosting strike on Nazi Germany’s industrial heartland, breaching dams and unleashing devastating floods.

title: Brittney Griner is freed as part of a prisoner swap with Russia.
description: Ms. Griner has been at the center of a fraught geopolitical showdown between Washington and Moscow. The Biden administration traded her for Viktor Bout, a notorious Russian arms dealer known as the “Merchant of Death.”

title: What Drove the Creation of Working Dog Breeds?
description: Genetic variants associated with brain development help distinguish breeds designed for different physical tasks, a new study reports.

title: China and Saudi Arabia Sign Partnership Deal as Xi Visits MBS
description: The Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s trip to Saudi Arabia has been scant on details and heavy on ceremony. But it showcases the growing ties between Beijing and a longtime American ally.

title: Brittney Griner’s Wife Cherelle: ‘Today, My Family Is Whole’
description: Cherelle Griner, who had steadily put pressure on the Biden administration not to forget her wife, thanked WNBA players for their support.

title: Fraud Trial of Wirecard’s Ex-CEO, Markus Braun, Begins
description: Markus Braun, the founder of the financial technology firm that lost billions, is facing fraud charges with two others.

title: Who Is Viktor Bout, Arms Dealer in Swap for Brittney Griner?
description: Viktor Bout has been accused of supplying arms to Al Qaeda, the Taliban and rebels in Rwanda. His exploits helped inspire a 2005 film, “Lord of War,” that starred Nicolas Cage.

title: A Plea From Experts to Pregnant Women: Get Vaccinated Against Covid
description: Many expectant women have avoided the shots, unaware that the virus poses significant risks to the fetus — and to them.

title: Brittney Griner’s Release Puts a Spotlight on Paul Whelan
description: Paul Whelan, a corporate security executive, was arrested at a Moscow hotel in December 2018. President Biden says his administration is still working on getting him released.

title: Iran Executes Man Over Nationwide Protests
description: Mohsen Shekari, 23, had been sentenced to death on accusations of blocking a street in Tehran and attacking a member of the Basij militia during a protest.

title: German Plotters, Long Dismissed as Fringe, Got a Lift From QAnon
description: Reichsbürger, the movement behind a plan to overthrow Germany’s government, gained momentum from conspiracy theories that grew during the pandemic, turning it into a potent new threat.

title: Ukrainian official says 6 civilians were killed when Russians shelled a town center.
How Old Are You? South Korea Tries to Simplify What Should Be a Simple Question.
description: Three ways of calculating age coexist in South Korea, so lawmakers have passed a law uniting behind the world standard in an attempt to reduce confusion.

title: Russia Says It Shot Down Ukrainian Drone Over Crimea
description: The downing of a drone suggests that Ukraine is continuing to strike back at Russia with long-range weapons.

title: A ‘Stunning’ 1,300-Year-Old Gold Necklace Is Unearthed in England
description: The jewelry found in an ancient grave site in Northamptonshire may have belonged to a woman who was an early Christian leader.

title: A Smarter Robot
description: A new chatbot shows rapid advances in artificial intelligence.

title: ‘Zero Covid,’ Once Ubiquitous, Vanishes in China’s Messy Pivot
description: As China casts aside many Covid rules, it is also playing down the threat of the virus. The move could help ease the burden on hospitals but comes with its own risks.

title: How Will China Turn Its Economy Back On? The World Is About to Find Out.
description: Strict “zero Covid” curbs have been smothering growth. After easing them, Beijing faces the twin challenges of rising caseloads and wary consumers.

title: ‘Ebola Could Have Wiped Us All’: Slow Lockdown Haunts Uganda
description: The authorities hesitated to impose restrictions in the epicenter of the Ebola outbreak because of residual trauma from the Covid lockdown. Ebola then spread to the capital, killing dozens of Ugandans.

title: How the Global Spyware Industry Spiraled Out of Control
description: The market for commercial spyware — which allows governments to invade mobile phones and vacuum up data — is booming. Even the U.S. government is using it.

title: Inside the Case Against General Salvador Cienfuegos Zepeda
description: A Times Magazine-ProPublica investigation reveals how the U.S. painstakingly built a case against a Mexican general suspected of links to organized crime — and then decided to let him go.

title: Tiny Vanuatu Uses Its ‘Unimportance’ to Launch Big Climate Ideas
description: It wants a top international court to weigh in on whether nations are legally bound to protect against climate risks.

title: ‘Harry and Meghan’: What We Learned from the Netflix Series
description: In the first episodes, the couple describe ongoing harassment from the media and wanting to continue Princess Diana’s legacy.

title: Netflix’s Harry and Meghan Documentary Series to Be ‘Personal and Raw’
description: The documentary series is the most high-profile project from Story Syndicate, a company run by the filmmaker Liz Garbus and her husband, Dan Cogan.

title: A Surge in Tourists in Restive Kashmir, but ‘No Mental Peace’ for Residents
description: Visitors have flocked back to the region — proof, India says, that its imposition of control worked. But people who live there say fear and uncertainty persist.

title: In India, Fiercely Loyal Soccer Fans (of Brazil and Argentina)
description: A soccer-loving stretch of an otherwise cricket-mad country has taken sides and erected huge displays of devotion during the World Cup.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: A plot to overthrow the government in Germany.

title: A Gray Area of Loyalties Splinters a Liberated Ukrainian Town
description: “Friends are not friends anymore,’’ said one woman in the town of Sviatohirsk, which remains divided not by trench lines and artillery, but by where people’s allegiances lie: with Moscow or Kyiv.

title: Putin Warns Russians of Protracted Ukraine War, But Says He Won’t Call Up Troops
description: Vladimir Putin appeared to acknowledge that subduing Russia’s neighbor was taking longer than expected, but said there was no need for another draft now.
